update.description:
This pull request creates the initial version of the documentation. The documentation is hosted in the [readthedocs](https://readthedocs.org/) server and updates are automatically triggered every time we push a change in our repository.

You can check the documentation here:

http://ignition-transport.readthedocs.org/

There are quite a few more details that I'd like to add to the documentation but I feel this is a good enough starting point for a first pull request.

CI results:

* Trusty is [happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/39/).
* Homebrew is [happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/33/).
* Windows is [happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/76/).
update.title: Documentation

content.raw: Any reason not to merge this? Seems safe, and we can always update the documentation in the future.
content.html: Any reason not to merge this? Seems safe, and we can always update the documentation in the future.

content.raw: Oops true. Let me fix it.
But, the `cmake ` command does not complete since files like `responser.cc` do not exist. You could modify the cmake to check if a file exists.
content.html: But, the cmake command does not complete since files like responser.cc do not exist. You could modify the cmake to check if a file exists.

content.raw:
I was trying to avoid the creation of new `CMakeLists.txt`s for the tutorials and rather reusing the `CMakeLists.txt` that we have for compiling the examples.

This is the reason for telling in the next line to compile using `make publisher subscriber` instead of `make`. Do you think is not a good idea?
content.html:
I was trying to avoid the creation of new CMakeLists.txts for the tutorials and rather reusing the CMakeLists.txt that we have for compiling the examples.

This is the reason for telling in the next line to compile using make publisher subscriber instead of make. Do you think is not a good idea?

content.raw:
Should we recommend `ignition-transport1`? We have both formulae in the tap.

* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ignition-transport.rb
* https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ignition-transport1.rb
content.html:
Should we recommend ignition-transport1? We have both formulae in the tap.

  • https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ignition-transport.rb
  • https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ignition-transport1.rb

content.raw: I waited 100 pull requests for this.

content.html: Pull request #101: Documentation. Nice
